meanings.definition: To retreat or back out of a situation or commitment.
meanings.sent1: He crawfished out of helping with the project at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: She always crawfishes when it's time to take responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The cat crawfished away from the bath, pretending to be invisible.
meanings.sent4: His promises were like a crawfished boat, drifting away when needed the most.
meanings.sent5: The idea of facing his fears made him crawfish into his shell.

meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly or evasive manner.
meanings.sent1: They crawfished when confronted with the truth.
meanings.sent2: The bully crawfishes when someone stands up to him.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel crawfished around the dog, trying to avoid being seen.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were like a crawfished shadow, always slipping away from the light.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's heart raced as he felt the urge to crawfish from the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To engage in deceitful or dishonest behavior.
meanings.sent1: He crawfished his way through the negotiations, tricking everyone.
meanings.sent2: She crawfishes her friends by pretending to be someone she's not.
meanings.sent3: The fox crawfished the rabbit into believing he was harmless.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a crawfished mask, hiding his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The con artist knew how to crawfish his victims into giving him what he wanted.
